label: Description
value: Anglo-Japanesque design, containing floral and fan motifs. Printed in burgundy, green, pale yellow and metallic gold on tan ground. Floral and foliate border along top edge.

label: Provenance
value: Found in James & William Smith House, Roslyn, NY.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Rober Gerry, Roslyn Landmark Society

label: Description
value: Floral stripe design. Band of brightly colored medallions on green background, alternating with medallions on white background.

label: Provenance
value: Removed from the dining room of the Henry Western Eastman House,  Main Street, Rosyln, New York

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Dr. Rober Gerry, Roslyn Landmark Society

label: Description
value: Mostly architectural borders and moldings, printed in grisaille and metallic gold . Some fold-out pages.

value: Mostly architectural borders and moldings, printed in grisaille and metallic gold . Some fold-out pages.

label: Description
value: Volume contains 1,361 woodblock printed samples, 93 leaves. Designs include textile imitations, florals, geometrics, fancy gimps. Swatches detail the company's production from 1822-30.

value: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment and Decorative Arts Association Acquisitions Funds and through gift of Anonymous Donor and Bequest of Mary Hayward Weir

label: Notes
value: Volume contains 1,361 woodblock printed samples, 93 leaves. Designs include textile imitations, florals, geometrics, fancy gimps. Swatches detail the company's production from 1822-30.

label: Description
value: Bow-shaped joined crest rail above similarly shaped shoulders, over a back support of twisting horns.  Similarly composed arm supports, centering a leather upholstered seat on four twisting cow-horn legs terminating in brass claw-and-glass ball feet.  The front feet enclose opposing twisting horn returns. Part of group with ottoman 1986-39-2.

label: Physical description
value: Assembled and pinned steer horn, cut and shaped horn sheets, wood, metal, brass, glass, leatherette upholstery (modern)

label: Provenance
value: Jack Lenor Larsen; 1986: acquired by Museum

label: Notes
value: Bow-shaped joined crest rail above similarly shaped shoulders, over a back support of twisting horns. The front feet enclose opposing twisting horn returns. Part of group with ottoman 1986-39-2.

value: Bow-shaped horn supported square ottoman upholstered in gold leatherette. Part of group with armchair 1986-39-1.

value: Bow-shaped horn supported square ottoman upholstered in gold leatherette. Part of group with armchair 1986-39-1.

value: etching on off-white laid paper, laid down on frame of white laid paper

label: Description
value: Ovoid body with five concave "dimples," tapering to elongated cylindrical neck. Flat base, wheel ground. Glazed overall in mottled brown/grey, striated with green. Glazed on underside.

label: Provenance
value: 1986: David Schafer (from Fine Art Society, London); 1986: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Cylindrical body flaring to circular foot; circular mouth with rising, elongated spout; squared, angled loop handle. Overall yellow-brown glaze, mottled and finely crackled.

label: Provenance
value: 1986: David Schafer (purchased from Fine Art Society, London); 1986: acquired by the Museum

label: Notes
value: Cylindrical body flaring to circular foot; circular mouth with rising, elongated spout; squared, angled loop handle. Overall yellow-brown glaze, mottled and finely crackled.

label: Description
value: Red earthenware body. Elongated ovoid shape, flared foot, flared "collar" neck. Body applied with molded iris with purple glaze, and white water lilies, both with foliage emerging from stylized water lines. Body glazed in striated brown, green and white, with surface iridescence. Interior glazed.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 48 x 21 cm (18 7/8 x 8 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Red earthenware body. Elongated ovoid shape, flared foot, flared "collar" neck. Body applied with molded iris with purple glaze, and white water lilies, both with foliage emerging from stylized water lines. Body glazed in striated brown, green and white, with surface iridescence. Interior glazed.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 48 x 21 cm (18 7/8 x 8 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Two circular designs in pink, yellow, black with marbleized lozenge shape in center of each; stylized floral motif and shell motif borders, on dark olive ground.

label: Description
value: Oblong, with high flared sides; reeded band covers narrow base; silver die-stamped edge with egg and dart motif applied to rim.

label: Provenance
value: To Walter Phelps Warren from estate; 1986: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Cylindrical body with molded band 1/3 way up side, flared molded base, stepped domed lid hinged to long loop handle; twisted wire thumbpiece top of handle and heart-shaped end of piece; hinge has trailing molded end; fluted, scalloped collar at joining of handle to body.

label: Provenance
value: S.J. Shrubsole, Ltd., London; 1968 WPW; Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Shaped as bellows; long neck with double ring at lip, trailing decoration along side edges, central boss on side, 2 applied "handles" at bottom end.

label: Provenance
value: Cecil Davis, London; 1962: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Flattened urn-shaped body on tall faceted flaring foot with scalloped edge;sides of body fluted, a band of diamonds above, above that a band of silverwith slightly everted lip; high domed cover with faceted sides and finial cut with diamonds, notch cut out of rim for spoon.

label: Provenance
value: Good & Hutchinson, Tolland, Mass. (purchased Mid-Winter Antiques Show, NY); 1963, Phelps Warren, NY

label: Description
value: Flattened urn-shaped body on tall faceted flaring foot with scalloped edge;sides of body fluted, a band of diamonds above, above that a band of silverwith slightly everted lip; high domed cover with faceted sides and finial cut with diamonds, notch cut out of rim for spoon.

label: Provenance
value: Good & Hutchinson, Tolland, Mass. ((purchased Mid-Winter Antiques Show); 1963 Phelps Warren, NY

label: Description
value: Shallow round bowl cut with alternate panels of strawberry diamonds and panels with fan cutting and tiny diamonds, top edge scalloped; tall stem with round faceted knop, flat circular base with radial cutting on bottom; glass has greyish case, heavy.

label: Provenance
value: W. G. T. Burne, London; 1963: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Semi-elliptical bowl on hollow seamed spool stem and circular foot; gilt interior; base filled with lead-tin alloy; "JD" engraved on foot.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 13.9 x 7 cm (5 1/2 x 2 3/4 in.)

label: Provenance
value: S. J. Shrubsole, Ltd., London; 1969 WPW

label: Description
value: Tall cylindrical body tapering towards neck, wide flat lip with turned-up rim; amethyst colored glass. Hyacinth

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 13.9 x 7 cm (5 1/2 x 2 3/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Tall central shaft, facet-cut, on a domed base with shaped rim; double ogee bowl on top; 2 rings of 4 branches from which hang 8 small dishes/baskets with flat bottoms, flared sides and shaped rims; cutting on base, top bowl and small dishes of flat geometric design.

label: Provenance
value: 1977: Walter Phelps Warren (from Lloyds Antiques, London); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Bucket bowl, outward sloping, stem with bladed knop rising from flat circular foot with pontil depression. The bowl wheel engraved with initials “R E K” in rectangular frame centered on wreath of flowers and grain sprays; on other side: within a frame, a mounted horseman riding left in silhouette with hounds in panel below and birds in flight above. Leafy tree to right at panel’s edge.

label: Provenance
value: Gift to Walter Phelps Warren from Attingham Summer School Trust; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Tall urn-shaped body; tapered, fluted stem; square base with star cutting on bottom; tall domed cover with faceted finial; body cut with row of narrow flutes, band of diamonds, a garland circlet, wide flutes down to base; cover cut with conforming pattern; glass greenish and bubly, heavy.

label: Provenance
value: 1959: Walter Phelps Warren (from John Dooley and Sons, Ltd., Dublin); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Tall urn-shaped body; short fluted stem; square base with star cutting on bottom; high domed lid with tall faceted finial; body cut with row of narrow flutes, band of diamonds, a garland circlet, wide flutes down to base; cover cut with conforming pattern; glass greenish, bubbly, heavy.

label: Provenance
value: 1959: Walter Phelps Warren (from John Dooly & Sons, Ltd., Dublin); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Barrel-shaped body tapering at neck, shaped lip with pouring spout, loop handle; cut around center with band of large printies enclosing faceted diamonds, around neck with hollow faceting, around base with short vertical fluting; ground pontil mark bottom.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. Dudley Westropp, Dublin; Louis Wine, Ltd., Dublin; 1959: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Barrel-shaped body tapering at neck, shaped lip with pouring spout, loop handle; cut around center with diamond band, around neck and base with wide vertical fluting; ground pontil mark bottom.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. Dudley Westropp, Dublin; Louis Wine, Ltd., Dublin; 1959: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Round body with vertical fluted rim at top; loop handle; high domed lid with button finial and notch cut out for spoon; body and lid cut with double band of printies, a row of narrow flutes at base of body.

label: Provenance
value: W. G. T. Burne, London; WPW 1959

label: Description
value: Round body with vertical fluted rim at top; loop handle; domed lid with button finial; body and lid cut with double row of printies, a row of narrow flutes at base of body.

label: Provenance
value: W. G. T. Burne, London; WPW 1959

label: Description
value: Round body with tall vertical fluted lip rim; double knopped stem, square base; domed top with flat cushion finial cut with diamonds; lower part of top and sides of body cut with arched panels filled alternately with small diamonds or strawberry diamonds, row of blazes base of body.

label: Provenance
value: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Flat circular tray with raised vertical rim cut with diamonds; tall stem with central knop; domed base with wide flat circular foot; ground pontil mark bottom.

label: Provenance
value: W. G. T. Burne, London; 1959 WPW

label: Description
value: Ovoid body tapers to fluted neck, wide flat lip with turned-up rim and scalloped border; body and upper rim cut with diamonds, pillar flutes at base. Hyacinth

label: Description
value: Bulbous body, molded vertical fluting around bottom of sides, above that anengraved border of vesica motif with cross-hatching and stars; 3 double neck rings, notched; wide flat lip; target-shaped stopper with molded waffle pattern; maker's mark ringing pontil mark on bottom.

label: Description
value: Bulbous body, molded vertical fluting around bottom of sides, an engraved border of vesica motif with cross-hatching and stars above; 3 double neck rings, notched; wide flat lip; target-shaped stopper with molded waffle pattern; maker's mark ringing pontil mark on bottom.

label: Description
value: Capstan-shaped body, reeded molding middle; stepped domed lid with ball finial; long narrow s-curved spout; s-curved handle covered with wicker; wedge-shaped spout with hinged lid opposide other spout (to fill lower compartment with hot water).

label: Provenance
value: S. J. Shrubsole, Ltd., London; WPW 1971

label: Description
value: Bulbous body; 3 triple neck rings; wide flat lip; cut decoration on sides of 5 panels, each with arches on columns covered with fine diamonds and a star in center; prismatic rings around shoulder; mushroom-shaped stopper radially cut.

label: Description
value: Bulbous body; 3 triple neck rings; wide flat lip; sides cut with decorationof 5 panels, each with arches on columns covered with fine diamonds and a star in center, prismatic rings around shoulder; mushroom-shaped stopper radially cut.

label: Provenance
value: Edward Butler, Dublin; 1961: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Oval-shaped bowl with scalloped rim, on the sides a wide band of shallow diamonds filled with small diamonds or stars, a row of husks beneath; inverted baluster-shaped stem, high, spreading lobed foot with scalloped edge; molded star bottom side.

label: Provenance
value: 1961: Delomosne & son, Ltd., London; October 1981: Walter Phelps Warren (from NY Antiques); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Urn-shaped body, tapered neck, shaped lip with pouring spout, loop handle with 2 rows of cut facets along sides; sides decorated with engraved decoration of swags, flowers and the initials "S A N" under spout, fluting above and below; tapered foot on spool stem and flat disk-shaped base with faceted edge.

label: Provenance
value: Delomosne and Son, Ltd., London; 1962: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Round body on splayed circular foot, tapered neck, scalloped lip with pouring spout, loop handle; sides cut with wide pillar flutes, prism cutting on neck and below it faceted stem and slightly domed foot, bottom of foot cut with radiating flutes.

label: Provenance
value: Cecil Davis, Ltd., London; 1962: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum
